subject: Fashion
title: Annie Leibovitz's Celebrity Portraits
description: A quick win: understand Annie Leibovitz's Celebrity Portraits.

hook.text: Annie Leibovitz photographed John Lennon hours before he was murdered. The image became iconic.

buildup.text: She started at Rolling Stone, shooting rock stars. Her style was raw, intimate, and theatrical.

discovery.text: At Vanity Fair, she merged fashion with storytelling. Her shoots became lavish narrative productions.

twist.text: Leibovitz proved a fashion photograph could also be a portrait, a story, and a cultural moment.

climax.text: She made celebrity and fashion inseparable. Today, every magazine cover tries to copy her approach.

punchline.text: She didn't photograph clothes. She photographed legends.

quiz.question: What was Annie Leibovitz's signature contribution to fashion photography?
options: She merged fashion photography with narrative storytelling and celebrity portraiture
She invented digital retouching techniques now standard in the industry
She was the first woman to shoot a Vogue cover
